intro: Phebalium bullatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved hakea, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and leathery, while its flowers are clustered in cylindrical spikes. Phebalium bullatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to coastal conditions.
